etymology.description: semantic: 門 ‘gate’ + 日 ‘sun’; variant of 閒 with 月 replaced by 日.
etymology.interpretation: Sun seen through a gate evokes an opening or gap, extending to ideas of space, interval, and the area inside (a room). Replacing the moon with the sun preserves the same visual of light through a doorway, reinforcing the notion of an in-between space.
etymology.simplification: 門 was simplified to 门; the inner 日 was retained. This reduces strokes and aligns 间 with other 门-family simplifications.

examples.chinese: 我在房间里休息(我在房間裡休息)。
书在桌子和墙之间(書在桌子和牆之間)。
examples.pinyin: Shū zài zhuōzi hé qiáng zhījiān.
examples.english: The book is between the table and the wall.

examples.chinese: 两次会议之间有十分钟的间隔(兩次會議之間有十分鐘的間隔)。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng cì huìyì zhījiān yǒu shí fēnzhōng de jiàngé.
examples.english: There is a ten-minute interval between the two meetings.
